title: Sapugaskanda Refinery Closed, Again
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Sapugaskanda oil refinery was closed again from Sunday (20) night, due to insufficient stocks of Crude Oil.
The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) stated that Crude oil has been ordered from several companies.
Further, the CPC said that a specific date for receiving the relevant orders has NOT been announced YET.
However, the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation said that operations at the refinery will resume as soon as the order is received.

Meanwhile, the President of the Petroleum Branch of the Public Progressive Employees Union, Bandula Saman Kumara stated that the country’s need for oil refineries cannot be met in an environment where the existing infrastructure is NOT developed.
